results.title: They live
results.creator_credit: Alive Films, Larry Franco and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: Based on Ray Nelson’s short story “Eight o’clock in the morning”, this is a fantastically subversive film which uses the clever premise that those in control of the global economic power structure are other-worldly aliens. Masquerading as humans they are overpowering the Earth and its inhabitants with an hypnotic form of mind control - hidden subliminal messages in the mass media. Featuring state-of-the-art special effects and starring Roddy Piper, Keith David and Meg Foster, this fast-paced adventure hurtles the viewer into another dimension where all is not as it seems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alive Films, Larry Franco and John Carpenter

results.title: They found their place
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: This film deals with the problems of rehabilitation facing disabled ex-servicemen of World War 2, particularly those who have lost a limb. Something of the vocational guidance and the re-training facilities provided for these men is shown in this film.

results.title: They found a cave; Waxworks (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Children's Film and Television, Charles E. Wolnizer and Andrew Steane
results.brief_description: They found a cave: Four English orphans migrate to Tasmania under the care of their Aunt. Their Aunt becomes sick and is hospitalised, leaving the children to seek refuge in a secret cave. Excitement follows the children as they face danger and adventure in the rugged terrain before they are finally reunited with their Aunt. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy. “Waxworks”: A short tale about children lost in a waxworks museum “House of Horrors”.

results.title: They fought for their motherland = Oni srazhalis za rodinu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Epic film by Soviet filmmaker Sergei Bondarchuk, depicts the skirmishes faced by Russian troops, during the WW2 invasion of Stalingrad by the Germans. Impressive action sequences meticulously recreate the drama, danger, destruction and disorientation of war. Winner of the State Prize of the Russian Federation, 1977.

results.title: They do it with mirrors
results.creator_credit: BBC, Arts and Entertainment Network, George Gallaccio and Norman Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Miss Marple’s keen powers of observation and detection are put to good use at Stonygates, the rambling country house where her friend Carrie-Louise (Jean Simmons) and husband Lewis run a reformatory for young criminals. Shots are fired in a dark room but the victim is discovered elsewhere. Miss Marple soon identifies the killer. Once again, Joan Hickson plays the ever popular Miss Marple.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC, Arts and Entertainment Network, George Gallaccio and Norman Stone
